page.title: 05ECOLOGY/FLORA
page.content:
{
A Manpower Services Commission project improved a footpath along the banks of the Cairn from East Cluden to Cluden Lodge. There are a lot of fine beech trees up Birkhall Road and on Rosehill in particular. Some oak, ash, plane, chestnuts - young chestnuts grow along Kilncroft Road. Wild Cherry, copper beech and lime trees form an avenue from old Holywood . The policies of Cluden Bank,Gribton,Newtonrigg and Dalawoodie have some very handsome old trees. Planting in the parish is ongoing particularly by the Cowhill Estate. 1984 proved to be the driest summer in living memory; 1985 turned out to be the wettest. The average rainfall in the area is 40 inches or 1016 mm.
